headline.sub: Mugshots of suspected bomber released in Sochi
headline.main: Mugshots of suspected bomber released in Sochi

docs.snippet: The mugshots of a suspected female suicide bomber are released, as Russia said a suspected Islamist militant leader is killed ahead of the Winter Olympics. Gavino Garay reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: The mugshots of a suspected female suicide bomber are released, as Russia said a suspected Islamist militant leader is killed ahead of the Winter Olympics. Gavino Garay reports.

headline.print_headline: Mohamed El-Erian Resigns From Pimco, to Stay On at Allianz
headline.main: Mohamed El-Erian Resigns From Pimco, to Stay On at Allianz

docs.snippet: Allianz late on Tuesday said Mohamed El-Erian, Chief Executive Officer at its asset management unit Pacific Investment Management Company (PIMCO), has resigned, but would stay on the Allianz International Executive Committee....
docs.lead_paragraph: Allianz late on Tuesday said Mohamed El-Erian, Chief Executive Officer at its asset management unit Pacific Investment Management Company (PIMCO), has resigned, but would stay on the Allianz International Executive Committee.

headline.print_headline: Time of the Essence for Brazil, Says IOC Chief Bach
headline.main: Time of the Essence for Brazil, Says IOC Chief Bach

docs.snippet: Time is of the essence if Brazil is to host a successful Olympic Games in 2016, the International Olympic Committee President said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Time is of the essence if Brazil is to host a successful Olympic Games in 2016, the International Olympic Committee President said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Kansas Freshman Wiggins Still Seeking His Place
headline.main: Kansas Freshman Wiggins Still Seeking His Place

docs.snippet: Andrew Wiggins is finding it hard to be everybody's Super Bowl....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrew Wiggins is finding it hard to be everybody's Super Bowl.

headline.print_headline: Stocks End Mostly Higher; Dow Average Slips
headline.main: Stocks End Mostly Higher; Dow Average Slips

docs.snippet: Stocks are ending mostly higher even as a few big-name companies pull the Dow Jones industrial average lower....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks are ending mostly higher even as a few big-name companies pull the Dow Jones industrial average lower.

headline.print_headline: IBM Revenue Falls Short of Expectations, Shares Fall
headline.main: IBM Revenue Falls Short of Expectations, Shares Fall

docs.snippet: International Business Machines Corp, the world's largest technology services company, reported its seventh straight quarterly decline in revenue that also fell short of estimates, hurt by lower demand for its services and hardware....
docs.lead_paragraph: International Business Machines Corp, the world's largest technology services company, reported its seventh straight quarterly decline in revenue that also fell short of estimates, hurt by lower demand for its services and hardware.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Governor of Virginia Indicted on Bribery Charges
headline.main: Ex-Governor of Virginia Indicted on Bribery Charges

docs.snippet: Former Virginia governor Robert McDonnell and his wife were indicted on Tuesday by a federal grand jury and charged with accepting bribes in the form of money and gifts from the chief executive of a dietary supplements maker....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Virginia governor Robert McDonnell and his wife were indicted on Tuesday by a federal grand jury and charged with accepting bribes in the form of money and gifts from the chief executive of a dietary supplements maker.

headline.print_headline: World Cup Venue in Danger of Not Being Ready
headline.main: World Cup Venue in Danger of Not Being Ready

docs.snippet: FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke is giving Brazilian organizers only a few more weeks to show that the stadium in Curitiba will be ready in time for the World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke is giving Brazilian organizers only a few more weeks to show that the stadium in Curitiba will be ready in time for the World Cup.

headline.print_headline: Debt Headache for Thai Tycoon as Protests Bruise Baht
headline.main: Debt Headache for Thai Tycoon as Protests Bruise Baht

docs.snippet: A local currency hit by months of political unrest, and skittish consumers spending less are keeping the pressure on Thai billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont, who heads Asia's most indebted food retailer....
docs.lead_paragraph: A local currency hit by months of political unrest, and skittish consumers spending less are keeping the pressure on Thai billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont, who heads Asia's most indebted food retailer.

headline.main: He Is the Captain Now (at Least Everyone Tells Him So)

docs.snippet: Barkhad Abdi, nominated for his turn as a Somali pirate in “Captain Phillips,” discusses his first scene as a first-time actor....
docs.abstract: Barkhad Abdi, nominated for his turn as a Somali pirate in “Captain Phillips,” discusses his first scene as a first-time actor.
